intro: Nolana weberbaueri, commonly known as the Weberbauer's nolana, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its small, woolly leaves and clusters of star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in temperate to cold climates. Its flowers are often pink or purple, and it produces small, round fruits that contain seeds. Nolana weberbaueri is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
